intro: Globba flavidula, commonly known as the yellow globba, is a herbaceous plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes ginger and turmeric. The plant features upright, sword-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellow-orange flowers with a distinctive spicy aroma. Globba flavidula is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions for medicinal purposes. Its rhizomes can be used similarly to ginger, though it is less commonly consumed than other members of its family.
